title.rendered: Minecraft is coming to Xbox Game Pass for PC on November 2nd

content.rendered:
Minecraft is coming to Xbox Game Pass for PC in November. Subscribers can play the Java and Bedrock editions on their computers for free. On the console, the cult game was already part of the Game Pass.

The good news was spread yesterday in a 90-minute Minecraft live stream and also shared on the Xbox News Blog. You can play the title in two versions. In addition to the Java variant, which supports mods and numerous multiplayer servers, you can also choose from the Bedrock edition developed in C++. This only supports RTX and Xbox Crossplay.

The angular game will be released in a bundle on November 2, 2021 in Game Pass for PC. Game Pass members can then break down blocks for free and cross-play with their friends on other platforms. And you can try out the new launcher right away.

According to PCGamer, the bundle for all other players – i.e. those without Game Pass – will not come until next year.
